content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata xml:lang="en"><Esri><CreaDate>20070519</CreaDate><CreaTime>15034700</CreaTime><SyncOnce>FALSE</SyncOnce><SyncDate>20070329</SyncDate><SyncTime>16214900</SyncTime><ModDate>20070522</ModDate><ModTime>15580800</ModTime><PublishStatus>Published</PublishStatus><MetaID>{E55B93B8-C965-4F26-84AA-7FA56E22AC23}</MetaID><PublishedDocID>{1C31F93E-D54F-4A50-8772-2B9FCAEE574E}</PublishedDocID></Esri><idinfo><native Sync="TRUE">Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.1.1332</native><descript><langdata Sync="TRUE">en</langdata><abstract>The Barrow Area Information Database - Internet Map Server (BAID-IMS) is designed to help scientists, land managers, educators and the local community access spatially relevent information for northern Alaska. In addition to hosting information on current and historical research sites and infrastructure, BAID-IMS provides free access to satellite imagery and other remote sensing products, topographic maps, land ownership information and local infrastructure that facilitates research and science communication. We welcome ideas for how we can develop BAID-IMS to better suit the emerging needs of our user community.</abstract><purpose>This database is designed to support logistics and research planning in the Barrow area of the North Slope of Alaska.  In addition, this database aids in analysis, synthesis, and coordination for research projects.</purpose></descript><citation><citeinfo><origin>University of Texas at El Paso, Systems Ecology Lab</origin><pubdate>20030728</pubdate><title>Barrow Area Information Database - Internet Map Server, North Slope, Alaska, USA</title><ftname Sync="TRUE">ArcticFieldResearchProjects</ftname><geoform>Internet Map Server</geoform><onlink>http://www.baidims.org/</onlink><serinfo><sername>Barrow Area Information Database - Internet Map Server</sername><issue>Prototype</issue></serinfo><pubinfo><pubplace>El Paso, TX</pubplace><publish>University  of Texas at El Paso, System Ecology Lab</publish></pubinfo><othercit>C.E. Software components include: Microsoft Windows 2000 SP4 Microsoft Internet Information Server (IIS) version: 6.0 (SP 1) ArcIMS 9.1   Jarcarta Tomcat 5.0.28 Java Development Kit 5.0  </procdesc><procsv>ArcIMS 9.1</procsv><procdate>20030723</procdate></procstep><procstep><procdesc Sync="TRUE">Dataset copied.</procdesc><srcused Sync="TRUE">C:\\FTP_05\\Temp_Metadata_WAF\\BarrowAreaInformationDatabaseInternetMapServer</srcused><date Sync="TRUE">20070519</date><time Sync="TRUE">13575300</time></procstep></lineage><logic>All data layers in the BAID-IMS application have been standardized in the UTM 4 NAD 83 Projection.  These data were verified by Nuna Technologies and the Systems Ecology Lab at the University of Texas at El Paso .</logic><complete>Information about the locations of research sites in the Barrow area has been compiled by Dr. Craig E. Tweedie since 2000.  This information is continously updated and supplemented with data about historic research locations begining in 1945.  </complete></dataqual></metadata>
